intro: Conomorpha pastensis, commonly known as the Pastens' conomorpha, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
